title: Hypothetical API Documentation: Core Service v1
note: The provided backend analysis data was empty. This documentation uses hypothetical endpoints, models, and authentication schemes to demonstrate the required structure and level of detail expected from an expert technical writer.

api_overview.general_information: This API provides access to core user management and resource manipulation functionalities. All requests and responses utilize JSON format. Rate limits apply (typically 100 requests per minute per authenticated user).

authentication_authorization.how_to_authenticate: Authentication is performed by including a valid JSON Web Token (JWT) in the 'Authorization' header of every protected request.
authentication_authorization.token_format: The token must be prefixed with the 'Bearer' scheme, followed by a space.
authentication_authorization.authorization_scopes: Authorization is role-based. Endpoints requiring specific permissions (e.g., 'admin') will return a 403 Forbidden error if the token lacks the necessary claims.

endpoints.name: Create New User
endpoints.description: Registers a new user in the system. Requires administrative privileges.

username.description: Unique username for the new account.

error_responses.description: Validation error (e.g., username already exists, invalid email format).

endpoints.name: Retrieve User Details
endpoints.description: Retrieves the profile details for a specific user. Users can retrieve their own profile; administrators can retrieve any profile.

path.name: user_id
path.description: The unique identifier of the user.

error_responses.description: Forbidden (Attempting to access another user's profile without admin privileges).

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique system ID for the user.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: Timestamp when the user was created (ISO 8601).

NewUserRequest.description: Schema for creating a new user.

ErrorResponse.description: Standard structure for API error responses.

fields.name: message
fields.description: A human-readable description of the error.

standard_responses.description: The request was malformed, or validation failed (e.g., missing required fields, invalid data types).
Authentication failed. The request lacks valid credentials (e.g., missing or expired Bearer token).
The authenticated user does not have the necessary permissions to access the resource or perform the action.
The requested resource could not be found.
Rate limit exceeded. The client should wait before making further requests.
A generic error occurred on the server side. Contact support if the issue persists.

example_error_body.message: The provided email address is already registered.
